title: NYC Luxury & Convenience at a Great Price
text:
This is the place to stay if going to New York City on a tight budget. Many subway (train) lines are just a couple blocks from this hotel with just a few short stops into Manhattan's Times Square.
ROOMS
You won't get much of a view of Manhattan but that's OK. The view is still nice and amazingly quiet. You can see subways right out your window but their excellent insulation keeps the noise out.
Rooms are the size one would expect in a big city. There is plenty of room and many conveniences. Housekeeping does an excellent job keeping the rooms spotless. We were there for 10 days and housekeeping didn't miss a beat.
Amenities include a Keurig coffee maker in the room, complimentary Starbucks in the lobby in the morning and warm oatmeal cookies at night.
SERVICE
From the front desk staff to the waiters in the restaurant, you will receive impeccable service. One morning, housekeeping forgot wash clothes in our room. within 2 minutes of a call, clean wash clothes were delivered to us.
RESTAURANT
The food is good here but the service is better. Breakfast is cooked to order with a wide buffet selection. Lunch and dinner have a limited menu but the food tastes great. Prices are high but that's to be expected. There are many other restaurants and convenience stores nearby for a good, cheap meal.
I have stayed at many national chains in Manhattan but will always make this hotel a first choice from now on.
